title: test_availability_zone_detail v3 API sample test is racey

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/84476
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/84476
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=a70308a471c67386ad255e67e8971bbf96c31f18
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit a70308a471c67386ad255e67e8971bbf96c31f18
Author: Andrew Laski <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Apr 1 11:26:17 2014 -0400

    Check for None or timestamp in availability zone api sample
    
    test_availability_zone_detail depends on the services not having an
    updated_at time set in the database.  This is set by a periodic task so
    it's not guaranteed to be set, or not, shortly after the service starts.
    On a fast system the test reliably passes, but adding a delay causes the
    test to start failing.  Introducing a time.sleep(5) in the test seems to
    make it reliably fail for me.  The test should pass if updated_at is set
    to None or a timestamp.
    
    Change-Id: I976ddf5354a52ca06a6419a92abcacb7d2379a37
    Closes-bug: 1300810
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: Nice, we're hitting this in our internal CI as well (running on a slower VM) so I'll propose a backport to stable/icehouse.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
